basic.description: This course examines issues that managers must weigh in optimizing non-market strategies for dealing with domestic and international stakeholders in the global economy. Topics include the pervasiveness of non-tariff barriers, the workings of the WTO, the debate over intellectual property rights, and country risk analysis.
basic.subject: COMM
basic.title: Bus Gov't And Global Economy

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite     This course is restricted to students enrolled in the third and fourth year of their program.
